Here, I took a long time thinking about Bxd4. I was thinking after c3, my bishop will have to go back to c5 and I'm considering exd4. Of course exd4 is not a good move as it will block my attack on the f2 and my DSB will trap on the other half of the board from his king.
But i played it anyway thinking that I will have time to bring my DSB soon to the king side. I really should've played Bxe4.
When he played this move, I know that he is planning to exchange queen.
So, why wait?

Finally, he took the pawn. Now my pawn structure is a mess and my DSB is still trapped on the other side. I want to play Rg7 but I saw the threat Bxh5 will completely destroy my plan. So, I decided to play more aggresive.
Sac my rook and threatening his knight.

He took the rook. Computer analysis showed that this is a blunder and suggested white to play hxg4. And computer analysis also suggested that I play Bxf3. But I was thinking, if I played that move, his bishop can retreat and guarded the g8 square. I want to bring my rook to g8. So, I decided to play another move.
